content_blocks.title: MITRE ATT&CK Mapping

content.text: This attack uses the following MITRE ATT&CK techniques: Initial Access: T1566.001, Persistence: T1053.005, Execution: T1059.001, Credential Access: T1003.001, T1558.003, Lateral Movement: T1021.001, T1021.002, Collection: T1560, Exfiltration: T1567.002

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: MITRE ATT&CK provides a common language for describing adversary behavior.
memory_aids: 🎯 MITRE ATT&CK = Adversary tactics and techniques
content_blocks.real_world_connection: Security teams use ATT&CK to map detections and prioritize defenses.

post_assessment.question: What is APT29 known for?
post_assessment.explanation: APT29 (Cozy Bear) is a Russian state-sponsored APT focused on intelligence gathering and long-term espionage.

post_assessment.question: Which initial access vector is commonly used by APT29?
post_assessment.explanation: APT29 frequently uses highly targeted spear phishing campaigns with malicious attachments or links.

post_assessment.question: What makes APT29 particularly stealthy?
post_assessment.explanation: APT29 uses legitimate tools (PowerShell, WMI, legitimate admin tools) to blend in with normal activity.
